thread.title: Florida Atlantic: Running back Greg Howell is Owls' leading rusher
thread.title_full: Florida Atlantic: Running back Greg Howell is Owls' leading rusher - Sun Sentinel

author: Shandel Richardson
title: Florida Atlantic: Running back Greg Howell is Owls' leading rusher
text:
Time was, Florida Atlantic running back Greg "Buddy" Howell never got any carries.
So don't expect him to complain about receiving the bulk of them this season.
Howell has emerged as the Owls' primary ball-carrier after four games. His 70 rushes are more than twice many as any other FAU running back.
"I was waiting to see whatever they gave me," said Howell, who is the team's leading rusher with 354 yards. "I wasn't like, `Oh, give me all the (carries) and being unselfish. I'm a team player. Whatever they want me to do, I'm going to do."'
Last year Howell was working scout team before his redshirt was pulled when starter Jay Warren began struggling with fumbles. Warren was injured in the first half against Miami, putting Howell in position to gain a stronger hold on the No. 1 tailback spot.
"I've always like his demeanor and attitude because he's going to bring everything that he has regardless of the situation," FAU offensive coordinator Brian Wright said. "â€¦ You appreciate a kid that gives you everything that he has."
With an average of 17.5 carries a game, Howell has no plans of slowing down. He actually embraces the idea of the Owls leaning on him.
"With the carries, I feel good," Howell said. "The legs feel good. I'm confident getting the ball as many times as they want me getting the ball."
Next game : FAU vs. Rice, 2:30 p.m., Oct. 10, Fox College Sports.
srichardson@tribpub.com
